job_history.work_description: Provide case management (goal planning, safety planning, resources, regular home visits). Identify barriers to housing to prevent homelessness. Provide on-going education about domestic violence and sexual assault issues. Provide advocacy to help victims stay in their home (landlord tenant issues). Manage multiple sources of funding through T-housing grant to assist victims.

Develop service recipient's basic living skills (e.g., social, domestic, and hygiene) through instruction and encouragement. Coordinate and maintain service recipient's schedule (doctor appointments, professional team appointments). Adhere to service recipient's behavior and health management plans (administration of medication, use of behavior modification techniques). Maintain documentation on each recipient served. Serve as a good role model to service recipients.
Transcribe Tribal Council Meeting Minutes for the Tribal Chairman's office, prepare and submit minutes to appropriate persons and agencies per policy.

Conduct all program client intakes and interviews, obtain and maintain information on health and social needs. Explain program services, requirements and policy, procedures. Obtain and track client data though RPMS. Provide case management to victims in the safe house Provide peer counseling to victims in crisis, safety plans, goal plans Stabilize victims with family needs through referrals to emergency shelter, childcare, clothing, food banks and to various temporary job agencies. Provide transportation and supportive services for clients to appointments and provide court advocacy. Coordinate and facilitate Healthy Relationship and Women's Empowerment groups. Conduct outreach for the Domestic Violence Program at various events and make presentations to other social services agencies. Gather, prepare and submit monthly and quarterly reports. Maintain confidentiality per policy.

Maintain and Track client hours on State System (SAMS); prepare and submit monthly and quarterly reports to the granting agency. Conduct all client intakes and interviews, assess each client on homemaker needs. Assist Community Health Personnel with monthly luncheons and other elder related duties. Provide transportation to the elderly to various appointments.

Interview and explain laws, regulations and policies to customers. Evaluate individuals for physical and mental abilities to operate motor vehicles. Oversee technicians who were in training for driver's license for durations of three months at a time. Provide customer service tactfully and diplomatically in difficult situations.

interests: Volunteering for the Sexual Assault Response Team (SART)

skills.name: Case Management
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience providing case management services, including goal planning, safety planning, and resource allocation, across multiple roles.

skills.name: Advocacy
skills.explanation: Has provided advocacy services to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault, demonstrating strong proficiency in this area.

skills.name: Counseling
skills.explanation: Has provided peer counseling to victims in crisis, showing a solid working proficiency in counseling skills.

skills.name: Project Coordination
skills.explanation: Has coordinated and facilitated groups, such as Healthy Relationship and Women's Empowerment groups, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in project coordination.

skills.name: Data Management
skills.explanation: Has maintained and tracked client data, prepared and submitted reports, and managed multiple sources of funding, showing a solid working proficiency in data management.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has supervised technicians in training and provided guidance, but the extent of leadership experience is limited.

skills.name: Customer Service
skills.explanation: Has provided customer service in difficult situations, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in this area.

skills.name: Time Management
skills.explanation: Has managed multiple tasks and responsibilities across various roles, showing a solid working proficiency in time management.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has effectively communicated with clients, colleagues, and management, demonstrating a solid working proficiency in communication skills.
